video.title: Patriot Act with Hasan Minhaj
video.synopsis: Every Sunday, Hasan Minhaj brings an incisive and nuanced perspective to global news, politics and culture in his unique comedy series.

episodes.synopsis: Hasan exposes how TurboTax pushes taxpayers away from its free service to a paid option, and why efforts to simplify filing have repeatedly failed.
episodes.title: Why Doing Taxes Is So Hard

episodes.synopsis: America's winner-take-all elections drive a divisive, two-party machine that limits choice. Hasan explains â€” and champions a viable alternative.
episodes.title: We're Doing Elections Wrong

episodes.synopsis: As colleges become more corporatized and offer less despite soaring costs, Hasan considers whether the value of a degree justifies the price tag.
episodes.title: Is College Still Worth It?

episodes.synopsis: Local newspapers provide vital information in trying times, but as Hasan explains, private equity firms are pillaging these important institutions.
episodes.title: Why the News Industry Is Dying

episodes.synopsis: Hasan makes an impassioned plea â€” especially to Asian Americans â€” to take action in support of Black Americans following the killing of George Floyd.
episodes.title: We Cannot Stay Silent About George Floyd

episodes.synopsis: With failing supply chains putting healthcare and food workers at risk, Hasan dissects how Trump's use of executive power exacerbates the problems.
episodes.title: How Coronavirus Broke America

episodes.synopsis: Hasan questions the booming cannabis industry, which is being dominated by rich white businessmen at the expense of small growers and people of color.
episodes.title: The Legal Marijuana Industry Is Rigged

episodes.synopsis: As millions of Americans struggle to pay rent during the COVID-19 pandemic, Hasan looks at how this could lead to a widespread eviction crisis.
episodes.title: What Happens If You Can't Pay Rent?

episodes.synopsis: Hasan explains how U.S. policies and companies help spread obesity and poor health around the world, then gives updates on topics from past shows.
episodes.title: How America Is Causing Global Obesity

episodes.synopsis: With the help of Sen. Bernie Sanders, Hasan breaks down the financial burden of younger generations caring for their aging parents -- and themselves.
episodes.title: Why We Can't Retire

episodes.synopsis: Hasan talks with Andrew Yang and Cory Booker as part of an effort to understand how candidates can appeal to the fast-growing Asian American electorate.
episodes.title: Don't Ignore the Asian Vote in 2020

episodes.synopsis: Hasan looks at how billionaires use philanthropy to enhance their fortunes, influence public policy and distract from questionable business ethics.
episodes.title: Why Billionaires Won't Save Us

episodes.synopsis: Thanks to fast fashion brands, people are buying more new clothes than ever before. But our desire to look good is taking a huge environmental toll.
episodes.title: The Ugly Truth of Fast Fashion

episodes.synopsis: As thousands of asylum-seekers wait in limbo at the U.S. border, Hasan examines how Trump's administration is working to dismantle this legal process.
episodes.title: Trump's Worst Policy: Killing Asylum

episodes.synopsis: With the need for mental health care growing, Hasan discusses how insurance companies get away with denying coverage to Americans who could use it most.
episodes.title: Mental Health

episodes.synopsis: Five years after three high-profile killings by police, Hasan looks at the culture and systems in place that help officers avoid accountability.
episodes.title: The Broken Policing System

episodes.synopsis: In advance of Canada's election, Hasan talks with Justin Trudeau and scrutinizes the prime minister's reputation as a champion of progressive policies.
episodes.title: The Two Sides of Canada

episodes.synopsis: Cruise lines promise fun, inexpensive vacations, but Hasan discovers that major carriers are exploiting loose regulations on labor, safety and crime.
episodes.title: The Real Cost of Cruises

episodes.synopsis: Hasan examines how the U.S. government and the Koch brothers are sabotaging plans to revive and expand public transportation as infrastructure crumbles.
episodes.title: Why Your Public Transportation Sucks

episodes.synopsis: As overdoses involving fentanyl continue to skyrocket, Hasan traces the origins of the synthetic opioid and how drug companies profit from its misuse.
episodes.title: Fentanyl

episodes.synopsis: Video games are bigger than ever, but the people who make them are often exploited. Hasan takes a look at the darker side of the gaming industry.
episodes.title: The Dark Side of the Video Game Industry

episodes.synopsis: As millions of Americans lack internet access, Hasan looks at the ways government and providers fail citizens and how some cities are fighting back.
episodes.title: Why Your Internet Sucks

episodes.synopsis: In the aftermath of an April 2019 coup in Sudan, pro-democracy groups have faced extreme violence from a military desperate to hold on to power.
episodes.title: Protests in Sudan

episodes.synopsis: Hasan discusses India's election results, then relays the astonishing story of a multibillion-dollar scandal involving Goldman Sachs and Malaysia.
episodes.title: Indian Elections Update and the 1MDB Scandal

episodes.synopsis: Once a tool of British colonialism, cricket is now India's major sport. But greed and corruption threaten to undermine the game's global growth.
episodes.title: Cricket Corruption

episodes.synopsis: Though the NRA is best known for its agenda in the U.S., Hasan explores how the organization has been exporting its gun culture around the world.
episodes.title: The NRA's Global Impact

episodes.synopsis: Hasan details new threats to the Amazon rainforest and indigenous people in Brazil, then discusses the crucial upcoming Philippines election.
episodes.title: Brazil, Corruption and the Rainforest

episodes.synopsis: Just before voters head to the polls in India's national election, Hasan explains what's at stake for the worldâ€™s largest and most diverse democracy.
episodes.title: Indian Elections

episodes.synopsis: Hip-hop has already taken over America, but streaming platforms have allowed the genre to transform into a disruptive political force around the world.
episodes.title: Hip-hop and Streaming

episodes.synopsis: Two years into the Trump administration, Hasan spotlights how government officials have been quietly and systematically dismantling civil rights.
episodes.title: Civil Rights Under Trump

episodes.synopsis: As millions of Americans struggle with crushing student loan debt, Hasan digs deep to expose the negligent and dishonest practices of loan servicers.
episodes.title: Student Loans

episodes.synopsis: Hasan examines the major players in America's drug industry, and how the prices of life-saving medications like insulin continue to rise unabated.
episodes.title: Drug Pricing

episodes.synopsis: After addressing his Saudi Arabia controversy, Hasan highlights censorship in China and how a #MeToo movement has emerged despite government controls.
episodes.title: Censorship in China

episodes.synopsis: As social media companies grow into worldwide behemoths, Hasan reveals how they take advantage of outdated laws to curate content and avoid regulation.
episodes.title: Content Moderation and Free Speech

episodes.synopsis: Hasan takes on immigration in America, going beyond the headlines to dissect disheartening policies and the Trump administration's motivations.
episodes.title: Immigration Enforcement

episodes.synopsis: Hasan investigates the economics and shelf life of cool as he turns his eye toward streetwear brand Supreme, which peddles hype as much as its clothes.
episodes.title: Supreme

episodes.synopsis: A massive but little-known oil spill off the U.S. Gulf Coast prompts Hasan to examine the serious consequences of expanding American oil production.
episodes.title: Oil

episodes.synopsis: Hasan takes time out from his Amazon addiction to analyze the relentless tactics the company used to become the largest online retailer in the world.
episodes.title: Amazon

episodes.synopsis: In the wake of journalist Jamal Khashoggi's death, Hasan exposes grim truths about Saudi Arabia and the charismatic crown prince known as "MBS."
episodes.title: Saudi Arabia

episodes.synopsis: Hasan breaks down how a lawsuit by Asian American students against Harvard could kill affirmative action, and where a conservative activist fits in.
episodes.title: Affirmative Action
